H0.text: A metal is sulfur dioxide, a substance formed when sulfur (S) and oxygen (O₂) combine, and also formed when coal and oil are burned.

H1.text: An atom is the best description of sulfur dioxide, a substance formed by the combination of sulfur (S) and oxygen (O) and also produced when coal and oil are burned.

H2.text: A compound is sulfur dioxide, which is formed when sulfur and oxygen combine and also when coal and oil are burned.

H3.text: A nonreactive gas is sulfur dioxide, a substance formed by the combination of sulfur (S) and oxygen (O₂) and also produced when coal and oil are burned.

A4.text: Sulfur dioxide is the chemical compound with the formula SO2.

A5.text: It is a colorless gas with a pungent smell that is responsible for the odor of burnt matches.
